bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to E.A. de Schweinitz, September 6, 1900

div1.p: Reed offers advice to de Schweinitz concerning the examination of medical students. Reed has learned of Carroll's illness in Cuba.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to E.A. de Schweinitz, September 6, 1900

opener.dateline:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM AND LIBRARY,
WASHINGTON.
Sept. 6, 1900

div1.p:
Referring
to the matter of the ex-
aminations of students
who failed, I would
be willing to let Hagner
and Fisher frame a
set of questions for
each subject and pass
upon them, or to post-
pone the examination
until next course is
completed- I can't pos-
sibly attend to the matter,
at present, myself, as
my hands are too full,
cablegram from Cuba
last evening says:
“Carroll's condition
grave”- We expect
to hear again to-day-
I am terribly depressed
over this sad business,
